text: Small resto with great food good service and reasonable price  ginseng chicken soup must try!

Not posh just great food in a clean friendly environment at decent pricing. I like at simple spots where they prepare dishes that are better than i can prepare myself. This is it. Simple consistent and delicious. Hope they never change.ll

This place is great - a family owned Korean/Japanese restaurant in the heart of the Sami Fruit plaza.  I tried it out a year ago because I was desperate for sushi (Lasalle is really lacking in good restaurants), and was pleasantly surprised by how fresh and tasty their sushi was.  I've been going back pretty much on a weekly basis, ever since. My favourites are the Tori Age roll, and Kamikaze II, though their sushi pizza is decent.  More expensive than what you'd pay in Vancouver for sushi, but affordable enough that a couple  could eat very well for under $20.   Based on the other reviews, I'll try their Korean dishes next time I go.  Thanks!

I lived 10 years in Lasalle and never knew about this place!! It's really, truly a hidden treasure. Located in the Sammi Fruit mall, parking can be tricky but lucky for me it's walking distance from my office.  Sushi here was delicious and well priced. Staff was super friendly and chill. Glad my coworkers brought me here it will not be the last time.

A family owned restaurant, very friendly atmosphere. I didn't know we had such a good restaurant in LaSalle!  Kimchi and Korean carrot salad were delicious. I tried Soon Tofu tonight and it was amazing!

-ENGLISH-  Crying tears of joy right now ...  So today wasn't a great day and everytime my life is garbage I want a warm and delicious Korean meal (I eat a lot of Korean food actually ...) but I did not want to go downtown because I am lazy and traffic is crazy ... long story short, I remembered that little place "Misoya" last time I went to Sami Fruit in Lasalle ... so this is the incredible story of how I felt in love with this place.  This small restaurant, located in a mall, can accommodate about 24 people and they serve Korean dishes and sushi. They have basic Korean dishes like Bibimbap, Soon Tofu, Samgye-tang and Hyedupbap. Also they have a GREAT Banchan (Kimchi, spicy cucumber and Tofu) and they serve genmaicha tea!  I haven't try the sushi this time so I don't know if they are good but I bet they are incredible because my Soon Tofu was off the hook ... i had true feelings for that stew.   So please, PLEASE! Go try this place and tell them you love them because they deserve it!  -FRANÇAIS-  Des larmes de joie ...  Aujourd'hui, j'ai une une très mauvaise journée et comme à chaque fois que ça va mal, je veux un délicieux repas Coréen (je mange beaucoup de nourriture coréenne en fait ...) mais je ne voulais pas aller en ville parce que je suis paresseuse et le trafic est fou ... longue histoire courte, je me suis souvenu de cet endroit "Misoya" la dernière fois que je suis allé chez Sami Fruit à Lasalle ... donc voici mon incroyable histoire d'amour avec ce restaurant.  Ce petit restaurant, situé dans un centre commercial, peut accueillir environ 24 personnes et ils servent des plats coréens et des sushis. Ils ont plats coréens typique comme le bibimbap, Soon Tofu, Samgye-tang et Hyedupbap. En outre, ils ont un superbe Banchan (Kimchi, concombre épicé et tofu) et ils servent le thé de genmaicha!  Je n'ai pas essayé les sushis donc je ne sais pas s'ils sont bons mais je parie qu'ils sont incroyables parce que mon Soon Tofu était délicieux ... j'ai eu des sentiments pour ce ragoût.  Alors s'il vous plaît, S'IL VOUS PLAÎT! Allez-y et dîtes-leur que vous les aimez parce qu'ils le méritent!

Comment ne pas avoir remarqué ce petit endroit avant aujourd'hui? C est la fête de mon plus vieux et celui ci desirait goûter la cuisine japonaise. Nous avons fait une courte recherche sur Google et ce petit restaurant est  sortie en première page. Wow quelle belle découverte. Cet endroit est petit chaleureux le personnel plus qu attentionné et la nourriture tout a fait sublime. Il est evident que ce restaurant fait maintenant parti de mon top 5
